events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30, involving a rear-end collision with another vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial statement mentioning the vehicle collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and to coordinate the investigation and communications with the customer.
The customer was notified that their claim has been received and acknowledged by the insurance company.
Requested the customer's vehicle registration, police report, and photos of the damages to proceed with the claim assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police accident report and pictures of the damaged vehicle parts.
Investigation into the accident details commenced, including contacting the other party’s insurance and reviewing the police report.
The full investigation was completed confirming fault and assessing repair estimates for the vehicle damage.
A settlement offer was made to the claimant to cover repair costs and any associated expenses from the accident.
Customer responded with positive feedback appreciating the timely communication and proposed settlement amount.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager authorizing the payment to be issued for vehicle repairs.
The insurance payment was issued to the customer’s repair shop to cover the approved costs of the vehicle damages.
The claim was closed successfully after confirming that the repairs were completed and the customer was satisfied with the resolution.
